direction.raw_text: A nod to the gods?

Roy "Tin Cup" McAvoy is wearing every gimmick that Molly first arrived with -- plus many more. He wears a pendulum cap, his arms are strapped together, a curious triangular coat hanger type contraption connects his elbows, there's a neck brace, an ankle anchor, an arrow attachment to his left hand, a bucket for right foot, he swings a collapsible club... and a BEGINNERS GOLF VIDEO PROJECTS loudly from his VCR, so loudly that he never heard her knocking.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roy...   I gotta get some air -- TIN CUP Look at me -- (considering what that means) Well, not right at the moment -- but listen to me. You're with the wrong guy. I'm the right guy. Everyone tells me my face is all screwed up tight as a drum 'cause I've been crazy about you from the day you showed up wearing this stupid stuff and the whole damn thing has both inspired me to get here on the verge of greatness yet it's also caused me to get the shanks which could humiliate me in front of a zillion people. (beat) Such is life. So dump that phony bastard and come to the Open in my corner -- you can delay your romantic urges, which I know are lurking in there among the excess of brain cells you possess -- until the appropriate time... (beat) Tell me you're not at least moderately attracted to me. Tin Cup stands there with the ball still dangling from his hat, the leather straps, the bucket, the arrows -- for the moment he's forgotten how stupid he looks.

direction.raw_text: . A COP grabs Tin Cup and Roy is ready to fight.   It's getting ugly real fast.

direction.raw_text: We'll throw your ass in jail right now, pal -- there's a lotta lunatics here and we don't take chances... At that moment David Simms pulls in, driving a con- vertible sponsor's car. He sees the scuffle, gets out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the problem here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This clown says he's in the Open... Simms spots Tin Cup -- a delicious moment for him. Tin Cup wants to hide but he just gamely covers his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hiya, David... nice sweater.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not on the list. Simms takes the clipboard with the list.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hiya, Roy... welcome to the big leagues... (checks the list) Here ya go, Charlie, his name's right here. (to Tin Cup) They spelled your name wrong -- easy mistake with a total unknown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Cop) Let him in. Simms smiles at Tin Cup, the easy smile of a man on top. Tin Cup doesn't respond, just asks the Guard:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which way to the practice range? As Tin Cup tries to regain some dignity, and climbs back into the Winnebago -- 91.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said he was a 'legend'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh he is... he's a very big name at a driving range in Salome, Texas... They all have a good laugh, and -- CUT TO: 91   EXT. PRACTICE RANGE - DAY                                   91 Lots of the big names are there.   Romeo is like a kid at the ballpark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look! Right there! Fred Couples... and Ray Floyd! Romeo notices that Tin Cup is staring at the pile of practice balls lying there on the tee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at these balls. Brand new Titleists. Lookit 'em, every one a brand new Titleist. (lowers his voice) Sneak a few in the bag when you get a chance. We swipe enough free shit we might even pay for this fiasco. Tin Cup limbers up, trying not to be in awe of the real legends who line the practice range, hitting beautiful shot after beautiful shot with graceful ease.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think it would be inappropriate to ask Ray Floyd for an autograph?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it's a dead giveaway, Romes... but if I still got the shanks we're gonna be found out real fast... Tin Cup nudges a ball from the pile into address position. Romeo hands him a different club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hit the seven iron. You never miss the seven...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good thought, Pods... Tin Cup waggles, shakes, limbers, addresses...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dollar bills... And he swings. THWOCK! A hideous shank squirrels across line, almost hitting a group of U.S. Open officials. Heads turn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to anyone who'll listen) Who hit that shot? Anybody see? He addresses another one.   And swings. THWOCK!   A disaster.   He crumbles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little thin, Boss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little fucking thin?! I still got the shanks! Everybody's watching! Christ, Simms is here... Simms has arrived and is watching Tin Cup with delight as he loosens up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we should work on putting. Ya can't shank a putt. Tin Cup pretends to limber a little more before daring to strike another ball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're the Mexican Mac O'Grady, Romes, you gotta figure out why I'm still shanking the ball. (beat) What's the problem? I'm catching it on the hosel, right? Moving my head? I'm laying off it, I'm pronating, I'm supinating, I'm clearing too early, I'm clearing too late, I'm off plane, I ain't dropping in -- oh, God, my swing feels like an unfolding lawn chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a virus in your brain.   I 93. got to kill the brain to kill the virus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything.   Kill me now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put all your change in your right pocket. Tin Cup follows orders, not questioning the logic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very good. Now tie your left shoelace in a double knot. Again, Tin Cup dutifully follows orders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Esta bueno. Now, turn your hat around backwards and put a blue tee behind your right ear...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll look like a fool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you think you look like hitting those squirrelly chili peppers up Freddy Couples' ass, eh? Do what I say or I quit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, okay...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perfect... now hit a seven iron into that tree over there. You're ready. Tin Cup hits a perfect seven iron into the trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd I do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ain't thinking about shanking, you ain't thinking about the doctor lady, you ain't thinking period. You just lookin' like a fool and hittin' it pure -- your natural state.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You cured.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it. Your brain was getting in the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's rarely been a problem. What now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I should recommend you go work on your short game but I think it's better if you go get drunk instead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get drunk?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. You always play better when you're wasted. Tin Cups stares at the swami, and -- CUT TO: 92   INT. WINNEBAGO (IN PARKING LOT) - NIGHT                    92 Again to GEORGE JONES on the CASSETTE PLAYER, Tin Cup is doing a slow dance with his driver. Romeo sits on the couch, stone cold sober, pouring drink after drink for Tin Cup, who's thoroughly plastered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's three in the morning, Romes, what time I tee off?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seven-o-five... first group off... Keep drinking, keep dancing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's four hours from now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're drinking till five... c'mon, c'mon, have another -- (a tough coach) Get you in shape -- 95. Tin Cup tosses down yet another drink, and staggers around the room with his driver until, finally, he collapses in a heap on the floor. Romeo looks down at him coolly, like horse trainer Wayne Lukas sizing up his Derby entry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing like the sight of a finely-tuned athlete on the verge of greatness... Romeo tosses a blanket over Tin Cup lying on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A93   EXT. PINE HILLS CLUBHOUSE - EARLY MORNING                    A93 Two figures hurry across the lawn to the first tee.    Our intrepid Don Quixote and Sancho Panza. 93    EXT. GOLF COURSE - EARLY MORNING                             93 The first tee -- the early morning air is heavy and still. The course is quiet and wet with dew. The gallery is sparse. The silence is broken by the starter's voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the honor in the 7:08 pairing, from Salome, Texas, Mr. Roy McAvoy. A half-dozen people clap, and -- Tin Cup and Romeo stagger to the tee, barely making it on time. Tin Cup is massively hung-over and unshaven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No time for a bucket, eh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost missed the starting time trying to get you off the floor, boss. You don't handle the hooch like you used to... Tin Cup tries to get warm quickly, taking a few hurried practice swings. The early tee times are strictly for the longest of long shots, and almost nobody is around. Tin Cup's hand shakes as he closes the Velcro flap on his glove. He's wearing the hat and shirt with the sew-on patches, as he stares down the first fairway. Romeo hands him a driver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I seen this hole on TV. Hit the big dog down the chute -- TIN CUP No, I've learned my lesson. Gonna play it safe, smart, conservative. Fairways and greens. Hand me the two iron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thought of the day is -- `be humble.' And Tin Cup launches a two iron down the first fairway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 94   EXT. SCOREBOARD - DAY (LATER)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eighty-three.    Well, you humble now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eleven bogeys and seven pars. I didn't make a three. I didn't make one goddam three all day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You weren't trying to make threes. You were trying to avoid making thirteen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was hungover!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe that was a coaching error on my part.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, amigo...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 95   INT. CLUBHOUSE BAR - CLOSE ON TELEVISION ABOVE BAR -
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The scorer posts an eighty-three next to Tin Cup's name. Tin Cup stares, shell-shocked, as his score is posted.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . David Simms is interviewed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm the last person who expected me to come out of the blocks with a sixty-seven and lead the Open... It's been a long time since I played this game with the fire and determination you need to win...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Anti-Christ shoots 67, you believe it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ol' Anti-Christ got a hot putter...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... you see, this game is all about integrity and tradition and honor...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? It's about cheating and racism and bullshit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, boss...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 96   EXT. JUST OFF EIGHTEENTH - DAY (SAME TIME)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Live coverage of the Simms interview. Molly is among a small crowd gathered to watch. He doesn't seem to know that she's there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So tomorrow I'll just go out there and try to make some good swings and, Lord willing, maybe I can put up another good number. Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, David Simms, a brilliant opening round 67 to take the lead. Simms walks away, now off-camera.   FANS call out -- 98.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: David!   David!     Over here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gotta go. Simms cuts down behind the tent toward the clubhouse, away from the galleries. The marshals open a rope allowing him to avoid the crowds, but -- An ELDERLY COUPLE with a young child are there.   The lady has a tiny dog in her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, Mr. Simms! (off no response) Can you sign an autograph for our grandson?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't you see I'm busy?! I'm working! This is my office! Do I come to your office and ask you for an autograph?! Jesus... He practically stiff-arms them as he passes, heading up to the clubhouse. They stand there in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who the fuck these people think they are... CAMERA PANS OVER TO the edge of the tent. Molly, trying to get to David, has seen the whole thing. CLOSE ON MOLLY She speaks to herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old people, children, and dogs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 97   INT. CLUBHOUSE BAR - SUNSET                                  97 Simms enters to numerous congratulations from officials, caddies, other PLAYERS. Instantly, in public, he feigns humility with convincing flair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helluva round, Dave!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got lucky out there...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great start, Simmsy... Simms stops when he sees Tin Cup and Romeo drowning their sorrows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Tin Cup -- heard you put a monster number up there...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coulda been worse... A small bar crowd is enjoying Simms' taunts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I played in the Pro-Am with some asshole movie star shot 82 here once... how did a great ball- striker like you, a `legend,' manage to shoot an 83?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I missed a four foot putt on the eighteen for an 82, that's how...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It ain't like playing some muni track in Brownsville, is it? A voice interrupts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does, `integrity, tradition, and honor' include kicking a man when he's down?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Mol', this is just guy stuff, bar talk, part of the game -- no offense, right, Cup? No answer.    Tin Cup's about as low as one can go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This man still has a lot of good golf shots in his system -- TIN CUP (trying to hide) Molly, it's okay, go away... I don't need any attention right
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . now...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Tin Cup) You the guy shot 83?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: David, I'll bet you a hundred dollars right now that Roy here can hit a ball -- (looks around)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from right here to... through that door to the patio... She points to a double door, forty feet away across, the bar, about an 8 x 8 foot opening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Molly, please...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to bartender) And give me a vodka tonic with a twist -- SIMMS Molly, really, this isn't... dignified...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanta go back to Texas...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the river, the piranha, the immortality? All that bullshit? You gonna drag your ass home with an 83? (looks around) In fact, two hundred says he can hit it through that door, over the patio, into the river, and make that pelican fly off that post. Everyone strains to look -- POV - ABOUT 170 YARDS AWAY A pelican sits on a piling in the river.   Impossible. BACK TO SCENE 101.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is ridiculous... But Romeo's sizing it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got that shot, Pods, hood the seven, turn it over, start it low, right to left... Molly takes a swig of her drink and slaps some money on the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not leaving till one of you men starts acting in a manly fashion. Simms puts a hundred dollar bill on the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's just get this over with. One ball, one swing, one gull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roy? Tin Cup still sits, head half buried at the bar. He's never passed up such an opportunity, but he's pretty low.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You the man. He turns from his bar stool, glances at the situation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One swing?   Four to one odds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll make it ten to one. Stick it up your ass. I'm leading the Open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now we're talking! Manly men! Whoas! From the barside gallery. Tin Cup rises and someone hands him a club. Suddenly there's a crowd, including Gary McCord who's been watching from the far end of the bar. He grabs a seltzer hose as if it's a mike and begins announcing. McCORD ... He's looking at thirty yards of bar and grill, an opening through the French doors, forty yards of patio umbrellas, a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . hundred yards of water, and a lonely pelican sitting out there in a 15 mile an hour breeze, south by southwest... (beat) He'll probably try to shut down a four iron -- no, he's selected his trusty seven iron... Tin Cup steps up to a ball lying on the carpet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kind of a thin lie...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beats all that deep rough you were in today...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fore in the grill! Fore on the patio! You're the legend, boss... Tin Cup suddenly backs off the swing and turns to Molly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this all about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up and hit the ball. McCORD (on "mike") The Ledge still has to be thinking about that brutal, ego-sapping, manhood-robbing eighty-three he buried himself under yesterday. I mean, that's just an avalanche of golf swings, a landslide, a pyroclastic flow -- TIN CUP Dollar bills... 98   And he swings -- the ball rockets through the hall and     98 clears the open door... The bettors pile from the bar and grill and race to the patio to watch the flight of the ball, as -- It's carrying, it's hooking, it's carrying, then: THWACK! -- It hits the piling!    The SEAGULL lifts off, SCREECHING angrily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stiff, baby, stiff!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 99    A whoop goes up -- And Simms storms out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm outta here. You're all nuts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I musta been blind thinking you were worth a shit, Simmsy! (raucously) Drinks on me, boys! Helluva shot, Roy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually I thinned it a little or that pelican'd be flying around with a Titleist up his ass... This is the old Tin Cup -- and he's in the clubhouse with an eightyfuckingthree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 100   EXT. WINNEBAGO IN PARKING LOT - NIGHT                       100 Pouring rain -- Lightning and THUNDERSTORMS.   It pours down on the club and the beat-up RV. Romeo stands outside with an umbrella, dragging on a cigarette, trying to stay warm. 101   INT. WINNEBAGO - NIGHT                                      101 Tin Cup and Molly in bed, lit only by light spilling in from a parking lamp. They make love with enthusiasm, finally wobbling to a stop. Silence, except for the rain.   Until:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I kinda shanked it, eh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, no... you were great...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tempo is everything...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perfection's unobtainable...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mighta rushed it on the downswing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come over the top a little...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... well, as Walter Hagen once said -- 'Sex and golf are the only two things you can be bad at and still enjoy...'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's take a mulligan and tee it up again -- They embrace with enthusiasm and start thrashing again. 102   BACK OUTSIDE                                                 102 Romeo's patience is getting thin.   He pounds on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys done yet? This is no time for a marathon... The rain keeps coming down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 103   EXT. GOLF COURSE - NEXT DAY                                  103 Galleries line fairways and fill stands. The course is wet, the skies threatening, but play is underway. 104   EXT. TELEVISION TOWER - DAY                                  104 JIM NANTZ in the booth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun is struggling to come out, the course is drying up, and in case you're just joining us, the leaders have just reached the ninth hole because of delayed starting times -- (beat)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: David Simms is clinging to a one shot lead over Peter Jacobsen... but the real story is out on sixteen where a driving range pro who shot an opening eighty-three is making a run at perhaps the most legendary round of golf in Open history, Johnny Miller's sixty-three at Oakmont -- Ben Wright is in the tower at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . sixteen... CUT TO: 105    EXT. SIXTEENTH HOLE - DAY                                   105 We hear Ben Wright's voice as Tin Cup marks his ball on the green. A small gallery has begun to follow him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If anyone was ever to make a run at what is the most storied number in Open history, Miller's sixty- three, it would be today when the rain has softened the greens, enabling the players to take dead aim at the flags. Still, the unswerving courage of an unknown driving range pro from Salome has raised that humble journeyman from the ashes of an ignominious eighty-three to wave a mighty fist at the pantheon of golf's immortals. This man, this Roy McAvoy has laid siege to the record book by birdieing the first seven holes. A brave par from the water at eight, and a glorious birdie three at the daunting twelfth, another at thirteen... Tin Cup gets his read, and steps up to putt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... this putt to go ten under for the day... Tin Cup putts -- When the ball is still two feet from the hole, Tin Cup raises his putter in triumph... and sure enough, the ball drops in the hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 106    EXT. GOLF COURSE - HIGH ANGLE - DAY                         106 Golf fans stream from other fairways to catch up as: A107   EXT. SEVENTEENTH GREEN                                      A107 Tin Cup knocks his approach to within six feet of the cup. The swelling gallery at the green roars. CUT TO: 106. 107   INT. DRIVING RANGE (SALOME) - EVENING                       107 Doreen is behind the till. The regulars and several customers crowd the counter, staring up at the TELEVISION as Dewey rushes in from his job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They said on the radio he was ten under -- EVERYONE Shhhh!!! Silence, everyone watching the TV, everyone starting to contort in body-English, then: A joyous roar -- Tin Cup's putt went down.    Earl twirls with glee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's shooting the lowest round ever!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And eighteen's a par five. A birdie there, he shoots sixty!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We gotta go, boys. We gotta get us on a Continental Trailways and find this damn place!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 108   EXT. TELEVISION TOWER - DAY                                 108 The MONITOR shows Tin Cup approaching his ball in the fairway. Ken Venturi is commentating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McAvoy's hit another big drive, but this is not a shot he wants to get aggressive with... 109   EXT. EIGHTEENTH FAIRWAY - DAY                               109 Tin Cup and Romeo survey the shot -- a long downhill carry over a lake to a slightly elevated green. A shot similar to the one he pulled off at the best-ball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two-sixty to carry, Roy. You got to lay up, man. I don't care how good you swinging. You got to lay
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . up. Tin Cup looks at the iron Romeo proffers. He looks back at the shot, throws some grass in the air, testing the wind. He looks at the gallery, the lake, the green, the whole grand setting... and then: He locates Molly behind the gallery ropes, watching.    She makes a little charging gesture with her fist. And: Tin Cup reaches defiantly past Romeo and pulls out the three wood. 110   EXT. TELEVISION TOWER - DAY                                   110 Venturi and Nantz watch Tin Cup set up to play the shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His adrenalin's gotten the better of him, Jim. If he lays up he takes bogey out of play.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But if he knocks this ball in the water he could make seven or eight. And he still has to think about making the cut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, every golf fan in America is pulling for him. 111   Wearing that look, the look of eagles, Tin Cup addresses 111 his ball... And he swings -- The ball arches off his club, the gallery roars, and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nope. ... Tin Cup drops the three wood on his bag, even as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carry, honey!    Please!   Carry! LAKE The ball plunks in the water inches short of dry land. The GALLERY GROANS. BACK UP FAIRWAY Tin Cup smiles at Molly with chagrin but not defeat.    He turns to Romeo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell. You ride 'er till she bucks you or you don't ride at all. I can save par from here. Tin Cup hits a wedge to within five feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up an' down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 112   INT. PRESS TENT - EVENING                                    112 Tin Cup is on the dais, fielding questions from REPORTERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you go from shooting an eighty-three one day to a record- breaking sixty-two the next?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it wasn't from clean living... Laughter from the reporters.       Reporter #1 follows up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you had to do it again, would you still go for the green on eighteen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. And I'll go for it tomorrow and I'll go for it Sunday, cuz I didn't come here to play for no second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 113   INT. WINNEBAGO - NIGHT                                       113 Tin Cup, Molly, Romeo all asleep -- In the same bed. CUT TO: 114   EXT. GOLF COURSE - LEADER BOARD - DAY                        114 showing Simms -8 through twelve, Jacobsen -7 through fourteen and McAvoy -7 through seventeen. 115   EXT. EIGHTEEN - DAY                                          115 109. A huge gallery lines the fairway and girds the green as Tin Cup approaches his ball in the middle of the fairway. The fans holler "You da man" at Tin Cup. CUT TO: 116   INT. TELEVISION TOWER - DAY                                 116 Nantz and Venturi in the booth. Tin Cup is on the monitor, arriving at his ball. We hear SHOUTS from the GALLERY, encouraging him to go for the green.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the same shot he knocked in the water yesterday. And the thing for him to do right now is to tune out the gallery, rein in his emotions, and forget what he said in yesterday's interview. He has to lay up. 117   EXT. EIGHTEENTH FAIRWAY - DAY                               117 Romeo palms the seven iron, waiting for Tin Cup to decide on his play.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme the three wood. Romeo picks up some grass and flips it in the air.   It blows away from the green.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's wind up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. 118   INT. TELEVISION TOWER - DAY                                 118 The announcers see Tin Cup taking out the three wood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he hasn't shown an ounce of fear all day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't courage, Jim. This is inexperience, pure and simple. 119   EXT. EIGHTEENTH FAIRWAY - DAY                               119 110. Tin Cup steps up to his shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is for Venturi, up there in the booth, thinking I should lay up... (addressing his ball) Dollar bills... He swings and holds the pose. He caught the ball perfectly -- it sails high and true into the luffing breeze, the GALLERY ROARS, and... ... the ball drops, SPLOOSH! into the WATER, a couple feet short of dry land. The GALLERY GROANS.` BACK TO TIN CUP Staring amazed, almost betrayed, that his ball didn't carry the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a long fucking ways. (holds out his hand) Gimme another ball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?

direction.raw_text: You're right.    What the hell was I thinking? And he starts down to the water. A THUNDEROUS OVATION greets his approach, and he raises his hat to salute the fans saluting him.

direction.raw_text: You nervous about tomorrow?

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'm nervous. So's everybody else. But I only gotta come and catch Simms. Sixty-seven guys gotta come and get me... Silence.   Except for the random snore.

direction.raw_text: It won't always be like this... y'know... with me... surrounded by all these guys... snoring... a stripper ex-girlfriend on the floor... my caddie sleeping next to her... all of us damn near broke... won't always be like this... She puts her finger over his mouth gently.

direction.raw_text: Yes it will... yes it will... and it's okay...

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: just don't tell 'em how. And he moves brusquely past Simms and out of the tent, congratulating Tubbs, the winner, as he passes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good job, Tubbsy... you won it. And out of the scorer's tent... 169   EXT. SCORER'S TENT                                           169 A roar goes up from the milling fans as Tin Cup emerges. He tries to smile, but it's all dawning on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God... I just gave away the Open... And then McCord is there, shoving a mike in Tin Cup's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . McCORD Ledge, I know it's tough to talk right now, but -- TIN CUP It's not difficult to talk... it's difficult to explain... I coulda laid up and still won. I made a twelve on the last hole of the U.S. Open. You know how much money that cost me? McCORD Cost you a bundle...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta get outta here. McCORD It was the greatest 12 I ever saw. Back to you, Jim... Tin Cup exits the scorers' tent and runs into the regulars -- They're beaming, undyingly loyal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Greatest 12 I ever saw... you crunched that dog, baby... gorgeous shot, etc... He looks up and there's Molly -- He stops short.    They embrace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Molly, I'm an idiot. I gave away the Open. The one time in my life I know the play is to hit the lay up -- my whole life and future and career on the line, and I still can't make myself do it. I am a twisted human being and a cautionary tale. And I guess I'm a fool?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.   A magnificent fool...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A170   EXT. DRIVING RANGE (SALOME) - NIGHT                            A170 Mosquitoes, pools of light, the TRACTOR CHUGS around picking up balls. CUT TO: 133. B170   INT. DRIVING RANGE CAFE - NIGHT                          B170 Romeo and Doreen eye each other -- locked in a stare of longing and mystery. TANGO MUSIC comes from a BOOM BOX. They begin to move toward each other in a tango step. CUT TO: 170    EXT. DRIVING RANGE - NIGHT                               170 Tin Cup and Molly are sitting, feet up, a couple Lone Star beers beside them, just taking in the warm Texas night. Her head rests on his shoulder. The world at peace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some people don't like West Texas but I think it's the most beautiful place on earth...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It has its charms... (beat) Y'know, by finishing in the top 15 at the Open you qualified to be in it next year -- TIN CUP Damn, I didn't know that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm thinking with your game you should go back to the Qualifying School, try to get out on tour...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I wouldn't see you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, I picked up a whole bunch of new clients at the Open. Lotta guys on the tour said if I could do that much for you, imagine what I could do for them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a lotta head cases out there, you could make a bundle...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And sleep in the Winnebago at night...
direction.name: direction
